means: 无礼而放肆的行为，厚颜
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 奇克绰号，面颊残疾或有疤痕者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“面颊”(cheek)

word_mean: 面颊，颊：面部两侧肌性部分
又称bucca 〔NA〕。亦用于指覆盖口腔两侧的粘膜，称为口〔腔〕颊(bucca cavum oris 〔NA〕)

sentence.Network_en: She knelt and brushed her lips softly across Michael's cheek.
sentence.Network_cn: 她跪了下来，轻吻迈克尔的脸颊。

sentence.Network_en: He kissed her on the cheek. "Best of luck!"
sentence.Network_cn: 他吻了吻她的脸颊。“祝你好运！”

sentence.Network_en: How did you get that bruise on your cheek?
sentence.Network_cn: 你脸上的淤伤是怎么搞的？

jx.jx_en_mean: (of two people dancing) with their heads close together in an intimate and romantic way
refrain from retaliating when one has been attacked or insulted

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cē(a)ce, cēoce 'cheek, jaw', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch kaak

entry.def: Your cheeks are the sides of your face below your eyes.

example.ex: Tears were running down her cheeks...
example.tran: 眼泪顺着她的脸颊流了下来。

example.ex: She kissed him lightly on both cheeks.
example.tran: 她轻轻地吻了他的双颊。

entry.def: You say that someone has a cheek when you are annoyed or shocked at something unreasonable that they have done.

example.ex: I'm amazed they had the cheek to ask in the first place...
example.tran: 我真惊讶他们当初竟然有脸问。

example.ex: I still think it's a bit of a cheek sending a voucher rather than a refund...
example.tran: 我还是认为，他们寄来优惠购物券，而不是退款，真是有些厚颜无耻。

entry.def: If you turn the other cheek when someone harms or insults you, you do not harm or insult them in return.

means.word_mean: 1. either side of the face below the eyes
3. either of the two large fleshy masses of muscular tissue that form the human rump

sentences.sentence: "he had the effrontery to question my honesty"

auth_sentence.content: Unwin defends her blog, claiming it was tongue-in-cheek.
auth_sentence.res_content: Unwin defends her blog, claiming it was tongue-in-cheek.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unwin defends her blog, claiming it was tongue-in-cheek.

auth_sentence.content: A piece of brick...struck him sharply on the cheek.
auth_sentence.res_content: A piece of brick...struck him sharply on the cheek.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A piece of brick...struck him sharply on the cheek.

auth_sentence.content: He kissed her averted cheek and left the room.
auth_sentence.res_content: He kissed her averted cheek and left the room.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He kissed her averted cheek and left the room.

Sentence.sentence: You would not be surprised if a stranger tried to shake hands when you were introduced, but you might be a little startled if they bowed, started to stroke you or kissed you on both cheeks.

jushi.english: She darted forward and kissed Mary on the cheek.
jushi.chinese: 她跑上前去,吻了一下玛丽的面颊。

jushi.english: I don't believe he has the cheek to see me.
jushi.chinese: 我不相信他会有脸来见我。

jushi.english: She looked up at him with an angry flush upon her cheek.
jushi.chinese: 她抬头看着他,脸上怒得发红。
